intro: Hibbertia setifera, commonly known as the silky hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with long, slender stamens. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in coastal regions of southern Australia. Hibbertia setifera has narrow, linear leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance.
